title: Ticket #1122: Add methods for adding TARGET scope in expressions based on ad type
description:
The existing methods to add TARGET scoping to expressions in the new ClassAd compatibility layer are aggressive, adding a 'Target.' scope for any attribute reference that doesn't appear in a provided list. This list is usually all attributes currently in the expression's ad. There are places where this won't work very well, because the ad can change after we modify the expression, or the full ad isn't available when we modify the expression.

We can define a new, less-aggressive set of methods that only modify attribute references that appear in a given list. We can then define lists of attributes known to occur in job and machine ads. Anytime a daemon or tool receives an expression from an external source (either a user or a potentially older Condor binary), it can call one of these methods to modify the expression as appropriate.

The lists of job and machine attributes can be built from the following:

  • Attributes known to be added to these ads by Condor
  • SUBMIT_EXPRS for job attributes
  • STARTD_ATTRS for machine attributes
  • STARTD_JOB_EXPRS for machine attributes
  • STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS for machine attributes
  • NEGOTIATOR_MATCH_EXPRS for job attributes
  • A pair of new config params to allow admins to add additional attributes

We will need some form of pattern matching for some of the attribute entries (e.g. slot attrs). StringList's wildcard matching should be sufficient.

Milestones

  • Define function signatures [DONE]
  • Write expression modification code [DONE]
  • Write code to create lists of job and machine attributes
